metadata.synopsis: It's another debtor that players can meet in Feast Hall. He is the reference to a character that was mentioned in Act 2, MasonCurrently he's placed in the Feast Hall (as it will only win from adding another character), and it makes sense for him to clean the surrounding mess.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. CTY_Main_A2. Talk to the debtorteleport S_LOW_HouseOfHope_Debtor_Mason

50.speaker: Infernal Mason
50.text: A builder. A creator. A saviour.

62.speaker: Infernal Mason
62.text: But at my foundation, I am a lost soul. We share that foundation.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Unless I'm mistaken, we've never met.

8.speaker: Infernal Mason
8.text: I know you nonetheless. Not by name, not by reputation.

1.speaker: Infernal Mason
1.text: As the steeple knows the arch, and the keystone knows the clay, I know you, for we are both parts of the same design.

95.speaker: Infernal Mason
95.text: Like me, you made a deal with the devil, and authored your own damnable fate for the greater good.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: What greater good did you sell your soul for?

85.speaker: Infernal Mason
85.text: Alas, it was a good that never came to be.

19.speaker: Infernal Mason
19.text: I was an architect in life, a builder of tombs and temples, but mostly of towers. My proudest work reached for the stars and sought to dry Selûne's tears.

20.speaker: Infernal Mason
20.text: It was a monument to life and to virtue, and a happy home to my master for many years.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Just as the moon wanes, Selûne's blessings always fade.

23.speaker: Infernal Mason
23.text: I wish I could say it were not so.

44.speaker: Infernal Mason
44.text: When tragedy came, my master fell into darkness and despair.

32.speaker: Infernal Mason
32.text: He marshalled a great army to ruin the world and bring all into shadow. I could not let it happen.

49.speaker: Infernal Mason
49.text: I sought out the devil Raphael and signed an infernal pact with him. He promised to destroy my master's army, and I promised him my soul in return.

12.speaker: Infernal Mason
12.text: The devil was true to his word. Fiends slaughtered my master's forces, but he endured somehow, and blighted the land.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: This is a familiar tale. Are you the architect of Moonrise Towers?

14.speaker: Infernal Mason
14.text: You know my work? I am glad that it endures. Perhaps you also have the misfortune of knowing my master - general Ketheric Thorm.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Ketheric is no more. I killed him.

87.speaker: Infernal Mason
87.text: Then all came to pass as I had hoped, though a century too late for my family and friends.

56.speaker: Infernal Mason
56.text: Your actions may have justified the price of my soul. I thank you.

81.speaker: Infernal Mason
81.text: Tell me - what became of my pride? What became of Moonrise Towers?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: We restored the spirit of the land around Moonrise. Nature is healing, and the tower can yet be restored to glory.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Moonrise is an affront to nature. It should be destroyed.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: The tower still stands, but it is a hollow place now.

99.speaker: Infernal Mason
99.text: Perhaps one day, new life will find it. Thank you.

65.speaker: Infernal Mason
65.text: Now, go. Finish your business here, and leave while you can.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Sadly, the curse still grips the tower, and the lands around it.

31.speaker: Infernal Mason
31.text: Perhaps it will fade into a long night and be forgotten, as I have. Perhaps that is for the best.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Moonrise is a cursed place - your legacy is in ruins.

68.speaker: Infernal Mason
68.text: All towers fall in the end. Thorm is vanquished - that was my purpose.

70.speaker: Infernal Mason
70.text: Perhaps it is best that I remain here, and that the long centuries erode my memories and leave me empty. There is a certain peace in that.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: We healed the land and lifted the shadow curse. Moonrise will be a beacon of light again.

17.speaker: Infernal Mason
17.text: I did not think it possible. Thank you - my spirit smiles for the first time in a century.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: The curse is no more, but Moonrise is tainted. It would be best reduced to rubble.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Your intervention pushed Ketheric deeper into darkness. He became a Chosen of Myrkul.

71.speaker: Infernal Mason
71.text: Then my pact, the loss of my eternal soul... it was all for nothing.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Not quite. Ketheric Thorm is dead, by my hand.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Dealing with devils never ends well.

40.speaker: Infernal Mason
40.text: And yet here you are, having made the same mistake. Find your contract, and undo it if you can.

58.speaker: Infernal Mason
58.text: You may be right, but those who live in desperate times often reach for desperate solutions. Be sure not to do the same.

37.speaker: Infernal Mason
37.text: Finish what business brought you here as quickly as possible, and then leave. Otherwise, you will be lost, like the rest of us.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Dealing with devils rarely ends well - I speak from extensive experience.

101.speaker: Infernal Mason
101.text: Whatever mistakes you have made in the past, your deal with Raphael can still be undone. Find your contract, and then leave while you can.

96.speaker: Infernal Mason
96.text: Those who live in desperate times often reach for desperate solutions. I fear we have both lived in such times, but there is still hope for you.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Pacts have great value. If yours did not, you were careless in making it.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: By my oath, I did what the fiends could not, and vanquished Ketheric Thorm.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: A life with Our Lady of Silver is a good life.

80.speaker: Infernal Mason
80.text: It was a good life. I only wish our Lady had not averted her gaze from us.

46.speaker: Infernal Mason
46.text: Deaths in the family. Happiness rarely lasts a lifetime.

30.speaker: Infernal Mason
30.text: A great general, a greater man. Ketheric Thorm.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I don't have time for this - I came here to find my contract.

100.speaker: Infernal Mason
100.text: You are right to hurry. My sorrows will only burden you.

67.speaker: Infernal Mason
67.text: Now go, find your contract and save your soul.

73.speaker: Infernal Mason
73.text: Perhaps you should seek out the Archive...

34.speaker: Infernal Mason
34.text: But beware, the House is architecturally unstable. Left is sometimes right, but more often it is wrong.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I don't have time for this. I came here to find the Orphic Hammer.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: How do you know about my deal?

42.speaker: Infernal Mason
42.text: There is a stamp on your soul, as distinct as a mason's mark. Raphael owns you, just as he owns me.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I need to find my contract to break the deal I made.

84.speaker: Infernal Mason
84.text: Can you be sure that breaking the deal will do more good than harm?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Yes, I already have what I needed from Raphael.

92.speaker: Infernal Mason
92.text: Then I hope you find your contract and free yourself, but I fear for you. This is a dangerous place.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: My soul hangs in the balance - that's all I care about.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: No. I made the deal to help save Baldur's Gate.

94.speaker: Infernal Mason
94.text: Then perhaps the greater good would be to leave this House, and to abide by the terms of your deal.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm not leaving until I find my contract.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Tell me about the deal you signed.

39.speaker: Infernal Mason
39.text: You linger here still? Or perhaps you have become lost, like the rest of us.

51.speaker: Infernal Mason
51.text: Another sorry soul come to wander these halls. What do you seek?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: What ties you to the House of Hope?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Tell me what you know of this place.

43.speaker: Infernal Mason
43.text: Despite appearances, this whole House is more of a prison than a parlour. Most here have no choice but to remain.

88.speaker: Infernal Mason
88.text: I am one such. This is not my home, but I can never leave.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I need to find the Archive.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm looking for the Orphic Hammer.

41.speaker: Infernal Mason
41.text: It is easy to look for a thing. It is impossible to take it.

59.speaker: Infernal Mason
59.text: I cannot help you. This is not my home, even if I can never leave.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Do you know Hope? I spoke to her a moment ago.

66.speaker: Infernal Mason
66.text: She will find you when you need her. That is Hope's way.
